intro: Chloropyron molle subsp. hispidum, commonly known as hairy bluebelle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its subspecies name "hispidum." The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to regions of Europe and is often found in moist, grassy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation areas.
